text:
Component request:
It would be great to have a “skeleton text loader” similar to the one on the Breeze intelligence page.
Ideally something like a block that resembles a text parent or similar, so we can visualise the UI while loading.
Currently we’re using small LoadingSpinners — even though we’re not really supposed to (sorry :wink:).

Interesting, but I did that as well. My React app doesn't have the scope, but another Private Project has the sensitive data scope.
I'm trying to make this GraphQL query within Postman using the bearer token with this new Private App. The query doesn't return a 500 error, but a "null" response for that specific property instead.
Also, I should add, this is using "Highly-sensitive data" property, rather than the "sensitive data" option.
<@U03U053QC72> I think GraphQL starts throwing 500 errors if you don’t toggle on the sensitive data scopes
And even if you do turn them on, but query a sensitive property it also errors out
Just an update, both sensitive and highly-sensitive are returning "null" for a test contact where the values have definitely been set
Hey <@U02F2QPB4P8> and <@U07EHBPLGLA> - I'd love to set up time and talk through your use cases. Would you be open to a call soon?
<@U07NWJRVBLJ> This should be fixed! Apologies for the issue
Anyone know how to solve some of the cut off of the button? Some code in reply
For context, I'm using Box to try and make sure that the button text doesn't get cut off. Otherwise, it uses an ellipsis for both of the buttons, and squishes the links
:eyes: Can both of you DM me the portal IDs where this is happening?
